title: Bank of China Net Interest Margin Edges Lower — Earnings Review
text:
By Yi Wei Wong

Bank of China Ltd. (3988.HK) released its third-quarter earnings on Wednesday. This is what we watched:

NET PROFIT: Net profit for the quarter grew 5.6% on year to 49.80 billion yuan (US$7.05 billion), due to higher net interest income and earnings from fees. The net profit figure beat a FactSet consensus of CNY47.90 billion.

OPERATING INCOME: Operating income for the third quarter rose 12.7% on year to CNY140.17 billion, beating a FactSet consensus of CNY136.89 billion.

WHAT WE WATCHED:

--NIM CONTRACTION: Net interest margin in the nine-month period was 1.84%, a 0.05 percentage point decline over the year-ago period.

--ASSET QUALITY: The ratio of non-performing loans in the nine months-ended Sept. 30 fell 0.05 percentage point over the previous year to 1.37%.

--FEE INCOME GROWTH: Net fee income growth for the third quarter grew 3.5% on year to CNY21.05 billion.

Write to Yi Wei Wong at yiwei.wong@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 30, 2019 07:06 ET (11:06 GMT)
